Context:
The George Brown College offers tuition-free U-Level Bridging courses for students who need to earn credits to meet admission requirements for their degree programs. These courses are not applicable to satisfy admission requirements outside of George Brown College and will not affect a student's overall GPA. The college offers four U-level courses: Mathematics, English, Biology, and General Science. The successful completion of these courses will satisfy George Brown admission requirements, except for the Bachelor of Science in Nursing program. These courses may only run based on student enrolment. Interested students should register and contact gbcdegreebridging@georgebrown.ca or call (416) 415-5000 ext. 3683 for more information. The assessment fee is payable through the Assessment Centre upon registration. For more information, visit the college's website and sign up to receive updates on application deadlines, news, events, and tours. Contact George Brown at ask.george@georgebrown.ca or visit their social media hub for further inquiries. The provided information is subject to change without notice.

Key Information:
- George Brown College offers tuition-free U-Level Bridging courses
- Four U-level courses are offered: Mathematics, English, Biology, and General Science
- Successful completion of these courses satisfies George Brown admission requirements for most degree programs, except Bachelor of Science in Nursing (S118)
- Courses may only run based on student enrolment
- Students should contact gbcdegreebridging@georgebrown.ca or call (416) 415-5000 ext. 3683 for more information
- Assessment fee payable through the Assessment Centre upon registration
- For more information and updates, sign up on the college website and contact ask.george@georgebrown.ca or visit their social media hub
- Information subject to change without notice
